did.unittitle: Long Island bills and receipts collection
did.abstract: The Long Island bills and receipts collection spans the period 1794 to 1886 and consists of twenty-nine bills and receipts from various places on Long Island (including Queens County) for textiles, dry goods, household goods, and horse and smithy goods and services.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Peter L. Van Santvoord, 1966.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The items are arranged chronologically in one folder.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was originally arranged into eight folders and was consolidated into one folder by Dee Bowers in October 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Long Island bills and receipts collection spans the period 1794 to 1886 and consists of twenty-nine bills and receipts from various places on Long Island (including Queens County) for textiles, dry goods, household goods, and horse and smithy goods and services.
